intro: Calyptrocalyx archboldianus, commonly known as the Archbold's calyptrocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to the specific ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
